perturbation.original_text: Except as otherwise specifically provided herein, ExxonMobil agrees to pay FCE the amount of each invoice under this Agreement within thirty (30) days following ExxonMobil's receipt. Notwithstanding the foregoing, if ExxonMobil has a good faith dispute regarding any amounts invoiced by FCE, ExxonMobil may withhold payment for the disputed amount, provided that ExxonMobil pays the undisputed amount and notifies FCE in writing of the specific amount and nature of the dispute promptly upon receipt of FCE’s invoice in which case the Parties shall attempt to resolve the dispute in good faith. The Parties shall endeavor to resolve such dispute within fifteen (15) days of notice of the dispute, and ExxonMobil shall remit payment to FCE within fifteen (15) days of resolution of such dispute.
perturbation.changed_text: Except as otherwise specifically provided herein, ExxonMobil agrees to pay FCE the amount of each invoice under this Agreement within sixty (60) days following ExxonMobil's receipt. Notwithstanding the foregoing, if ExxonMobil has a good faith dispute regarding any amounts invoiced by FCE, ExxonMobil may withhold payment for the disputed amount, provided that ExxonMobil pays the undisputed amount and notifies FCE in writing of the specific amount and nature of the dispute promptly upon receipt of FCE’s invoice in which case the Parties shall attempt to resolve the dispute in good faith. The Parties shall endeavor to resolve such dispute within thirty (30) days of notice of the dispute, and ExxonMobil shall remit payment to FCE within thirty (30) days of resolution of such dispute.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by stating that ExxonMobil has 60 days to pay invoices, while also mandating disputes be resolved within 30 days, and payment remitted within 30 days after resolution, which is now impossible to follow consistently. This inconsistency would create uncertainty and potential disputes over payment deadlines and late fees.

perturbation.original_text: Such notice, demand, request, or other communications will be deemed to have been sufficiently given by and will be effective upon the earliest of: (a) delivering the same to a reputable courier service that requires a signature upon delivery; (b) mailing the same by registered or certified first-class mail, postage prepaid, return receipt requested; (c) if an e-mail is provided, then by e-mail with receipt confirmation followed by mailing the same or (d) actual receipt by the addressee.
perturbation.changed_text: Such notice, demand, request, or other communications will be deemed to have been sufficiently given by and will be effective upon the earliest of: (a) delivering the same to a reputable courier service that requires a signature upon delivery; (b) mailing the same by registered or certified first-class mail, postage prepaid, return receipt requested; (c) if an e-mail is provided, then by e-mail, regardless of whether a receipt confirmation is received or not; or (d) actual receipt by the addressee.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by stating that emails are deemed delivered whether they are confirmed or not, creating uncertainty on whether the email has been properly delivered. This change also conflicts with standard legal practice, causing uncertainty on what the procedure to deliver is.

perturbation.original_text: FCE will keep, or cause to be kept, true books, records, and accounts in accordance with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles and containing all information necessary for the accurate determination of all amounts payable to FCE under this Agreement, and any other obligations under this Agreement. Such books, records and accounts will be maintained for a period of at least three (3) years following the termination or expiration of this Agreement, provided there are no pending disputes between the Parties. In the case of a dispute, the books, records, and accounts will be maintained for one (1) year following resolution of such dispute.
perturbation.changed_text: FCE will keep, or cause to be kept, true books, records, and accounts in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States and containing all information necessary for the accurate determination of all amounts payable to FCE under this Agreement, and any other obligations under this Agreement. Such books, records and accounts will be maintained for a period of at least one (1) year following the termination or expiration of this Agreement, regardless if there are pending disputes between the Parties. In the case of a dispute, the books, records, and accounts will not be maintained following resolution of such dispute.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces several contradictions. First, it shortens the record-keeping period to one year, conflicting with the original three-year requirement. Second, it removes the condition that the three-year retention applies only if there are no pending disputes. Third, it states that no records need to be maintained after dispute resolution, directly contradicting the original requirement to maintain records for one year after dispute resolution. These contradictions create ambiguity and uncertainty regarding the duration of record-keeping obligations, potentially hindering auditing processes and dispute resolution.
